com.smartnsoft.droid4me.app
Interface ActivityController.Redirector

Enclosing class:
ActivityController
public static interface ActivityController.Redirector

An interface which is requested when a new Activity is bound to be started.

The redirector acts as a controller over the activities starting phase: if an activity should be started before another one is really active, this is the right place to handle this at runtime.

This component is especially useful when ones need to make sure that an Activity has actually been submitted to the end-user before resuming a workflow. The common cases are the traditional application splash screen, or a signin/signup process.

See Also:
ActivityController.registerRedirector(Redirector)

Method Summary
 android.content.Intent getRedirection(android.app.Activity activity)
          Will be invoked by the framework, in order to know whether an Activity should be started instead of the provided one, which is supposed to have just started.
 

Method Detail

getRedirection

android.content.Intent getRedirection(android.app.Activity activity)
Will be invoked by the framework, in order to know whether an Activity should be started instead of the provided one, which is supposed to have just started.

Caution: if an exception is thrown during the method execution, the application will crash!

Parameters:
activity - the activity which is bound to be displayed
Returns:
null if and only if nothing is to be done, i.e. no activity should be started instead. Otherwise, the given intent will be executed: in that case, the provided activity
See Also:
ActivityController.needsRedirection(Activity)
